result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles P Cavanaugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th ), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: $600.00 fine, costs and disbursements and the DNA surcharge from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Pay balances remaining of all the costs, restitution, disbursements and supervision fees. Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-discharable in bankruptcy.
Court ordered defendant to pay $24.30 in restitution to the city of South Milwaukee

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs, and only for as long as deemed medically reasonable and necessary. If a treatment regimen is recommended, must take all medications as prescribed. Court ordered defendant not to drive while taking any medication or while under any prescription.

Parenting classes/counseling.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample unless previously provided.
Court ordered defendant to complete a Driver Assessment and Safety Plan.
No alcohol.
Urine screens.

AODA assessment and treatment.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (28 pages) commencing 08-04-2014, PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
/from WCS, filed. rn

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Charles P Cavanaugh not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from WCS, filed.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Charles P Cavanaugh not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
with turn over to Justice Point.

Defendant Charles P Cavanaugh in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Anne A Devitt.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Kim Schoep.
Filed, Justice Point Violation Report.  Court ordered signature bond forfeited and ordered bail set at $2,500.00 Cash with turn over to Justice Point.  Case remains calendared on 6-3-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for scheduling conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Charles P Cavanaugh in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 5/13/14.
css

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. 
IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles P Cavanaugh in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Charles P Cavanaugh not in court.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
AODA Assessment Form placed in Court File.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4-28-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
